eta_utility.connectors.node moduleÔÉÅ

This module implements the node class, which is used to parametrize connections

class eta_utility.connectors.node.Node(name: str, url: str, protocol: str, *args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

The node objects represents a single variable. Valid keyword arguments depend on the protocol.

name: strÔÉÅ

Name for the node.

url: strÔÉÅ

URL of the connection.

url_parsed: ParseResultÔÉÅ

Parse result object of the URL (in case more post-processing is required).

protocol: strÔÉÅ

Protocol of the connection.

usr: str | NoneÔÉÅ

Username for login to the connection (default: None).

pwd: str | NoneÔÉÅ

Password for login to the connection (default: None).

interval: str | NoneÔÉÅ

Interval

dtype: Callable | NoneÔÉÅ

Data type of the node (for value conversion). Note that strings will be interpreted as utf-8 encoded. If you do not want this behaviour, use ‚Äòbytes‚Äô.

evolve(**kwargs: Any) → Node[source]ÔÉÅ

Returns a new node instance by copying the current node and changing only specified keyword arguments.

This allows for seamless node instantiation with only a few changes.

Parameters:

kwargs ‚Äì Keyword arguments to change.

Returns:

New instance of the node.

classmethod from_dict(dikt: Sequence[Mapping] | Mapping[str, Any], fail: bool = True) → list[Node][source]ÔÉÅ

Create nodes from a dictionary of node configurations. The configuration must specify the following fields for each node:

  • Code (or name), URL, Protocol (i.e. modbus or opcua or eneffco). The URL should be a complete network location identifier. Alternatively it is possible to specify the location in two fields: IP and Port. These should only contain the respective parts (as in only an IP address and only the port number). The IP-Address should always be given without scheme (https://).

For local nodes no additional fields are required.

For Modbus nodes the following additional fields are required:

  • ModbusRegisterType (or mb_register), ModbusSlave (or mb_slave), ModbusChannel (or mb_channel).

For OPC UA nodes the following additional fields are required:

  • Identifier.

For EnEffCo nodes the code field must be present.

For EntsoE nodes the endpoint field must be present.

Parameters:

  • dikt ‚Äì Configuration dictionary.

  • fail ‚Äì Set this to false, if you would like to log errors instead of raising them.

Returns:

List of Node objects.

classmethod from_excel(path: Path, sheet_name: str, fail: bool = True) → list[Node][source]ÔÉÅ

Method to read out nodes from an Excel document. The document must specify the following fields:

  • Code, IP, Port, Protocol (modbus or opcua or eneffco).

For Modbus nodes the following additional fields are required:

  • ModbusRegisterType, ModbusByte, ModbusChannel.

For OPC UA nodes the following additional fields are required:

  • Identifier.

For EnEffCo nodes the Code field must be present.

The IP-Address should always be given without scheme (https://).

Parameters:

  • path ‚Äì Path to Excel document.

  • sheet_name ‚Äì name of Excel sheet, which will be read out.

  • fail ‚Äì Set this to false, if you would like to log errors instead of raising them.

Returns:

List of Node objects.

classmethod get_eneffco_nodes_from_codes(code_list: Sequence[str], eneffco_url: str) → list[Node][source]ÔÉÅ

Utility function to retrieve Node objects from a list of EnEffCo Codes (Identifiers).

Deprecated since version v2.0.0: Use the from_ids function of the EnEffCoConnection Class instead.

Parameters:

  • code_list ‚Äì List of EnEffCo identifiers to create nodes from.

  • eneffco_url ‚Äì URL to the EnEffCo system.

Returns:

List of EnEffCo nodes.

Local Node (no specific protocol), useful for example to manually provide data to subscription handlers.

class eta_utility.connectors.node.NodeModbus(name: str, url: str, protocol: str, *args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: Node

Node for the Modbus protocol.

mb_slave: int | NoneÔÉÅ

Modbus Slave ID

mb_register: strÔÉÅ

Modbus Register name. One of input, discrete_input, coils and holding. Note that only coils and holding can be written to.

mb_channel: intÔÉÅ

Modbus Channel (Address of the value)

mb_bit_length: intÔÉÅ

Length of the value in bits (default 32). This determines, how much data is read from the server. The value must be a multiple of 16.

mb_byteorder: strÔÉÅ

Byteorder of values returned by modbus

mb_wordorder: strÔÉÅ

Wordorder of values returned by modbus

Name of the OPC UA Node.

opc_path: list[NodeOpcUa]ÔÉÅ

Path to the OPC UA node in list representation. Nodes in this list can be used to access any parent objects.

evolve(**kwargs: Any) → Node[source]ÔÉÅ

Returns a new node instance by copying the current node and changing only specified keyword arguments.

This allows for seamless node instantiation with only a few changes.

Adjusted attributes handling according to OpcUa node instantiation logic as in ‚Äò__attrs_post_init__‚Äô.

Parameters:

kwargs ‚Äì Keyword arguments to change.

Returns:

New instance of the node.

Node for the EntsoE API (see ENTSO-E Transparency Platform API).

Available endpointÔÉÅ

Endpoint

Description

ActualGenerationPerType

Actual Generation Per Energy Type

Price

Price day ahead

Currently, there is only two endpoints available, due to the parameter managing required by the API documentation. The other possible endpoints are listed in

eta_utility.connectors.entso_e._ConnectionConfiguration._doc_types

Main bidding zoneÔÉÅ

Bidding Zone

Description

DEU-LUX

Deutschland-Luxemburg

The other possible bidding zones are listed in

eta_utility.connectors.entso_e._ConnectionConfiguration._bidding_zones

class eta_utility.connectors.node.NodeWetterdienst(name: str, url: str, protocol: str, *args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: Node

Basic Node for the Wetterdienst API. This class is not meant to be used directly, but to be subclassed by NodeWetterdienstObservation and NodeWetterdienstPrediction.

parameter: strÔÉÅ

Parameter to read from wetterdienst (e.g HUMIDITY or TEMPERATURE_AIR_200)

station_id: str | NoneÔÉÅ

The id of the weather station

latlon: str | NoneÔÉÅ

latitude and longitude (not necessarily a weather station)

number_of_stations: int | NoneÔÉÅ

Number of stations to be used for the query

class eta_utility.connectors.node.NodeEmonio(name: str, url: str, protocol: str, *args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: Node

Node for the emonio. The parameter to read is specified by the name of the node. Available parameters are defined in the parameter_map class attribute. Additionally, the phase of the parameter can be specified, with ‚Äòa‚Äô, ‚Äòb‚Äô, ‚Äòc‚Äô or ‚Äòabc‚Äô.

https://wiki.emonio.de/de/Emonio_P3

address: intÔÉÅ

Modbus address of the parameter to read

phase: strÔÉÅ

Phase of the parameter (a, b, c). If not set, all phases are read

class eta_utility.connectors.node.NodeForecastSolar(name: str, url: str, protocol: str, *args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: Node

Node for the Forecast.Solar API.

api_key: str | NoneÔÉÅ
endpoint: strÔÉÅ

estimate / history / clearsky

data: str | NoneÔÉÅ

Query data for only watts, wat hours, watt hours per period or watt hours per day; string

latitude: intÔÉÅ

Latitude of location, -90 (south) ‚Ä¶ 90 (north); handled with a precision of 0.0001 or abt. 10 m

longitude: intÔÉÅ

Longitude of location, -180 (west) ‚Ä¶ 180 (east); handled with a precision of 0.0001 or abt. 10 m

declination: int | list[int]ÔÉÅ

Plane declination, 0 (horizontal) ‚Ä¶ 90 (vertical) - always in relation to earth‚Äôs surface; integer

azimuth: int | list[int]ÔÉÅ

Plane azimuth, -180 ‚Ä¶ 180 (-180 = north, -90 = east, 0 = south, 90 = west, 180 = north); integer

kwp: float | list[float]ÔÉÅ

Installed modules power in kilo watt; float

time: strÔÉÅ

format of timestamps in the response, see API doc for values; string

no_sun: int | NoneÔÉÅ
damping_morning: float | NoneÔÉÅ

damping factor for the morning forecast solar API

damping_evening: float | NoneÔÉÅ

damping factor for the evening forecast solar API

horizon: int | list[int] | NoneÔÉÅ

Horizon information; string, (comma-separated list of numerics) See API doc

inverter: float | NoneÔÉÅ

inverter: Maximum of inverter in kilowatts or kVA; float > 0

limit: int | NoneÔÉÅ

limit: Number of response days; int ‚ã≤ (1,..,8), 1=today

start: str | NoneÔÉÅ

start: Start time of the forecast, PHP DateTime format; stringx

transit: int | NoneÔÉÅ

transit: Flag for including solar transit (midday)

actual: float | NoneÔÉÅ

actual: Actual production until now; float >= 0
